item.title: Found this plant not far from my place...
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
Deathmonkey7:

Honestly, I would say tobacco is a little better for you. But of course I’m not talking about modern day tobacco products. I’m talking about pure tobacco.

Legalizing weed wouldn’t be as good as everyone thinks, though. Why? Because companies would do the same with it as they have with tobacco. Nicotine filled cannabis cigarettes, anyone? And I don’t get how you can believe that legalizing it would take money away from drug cartels. It’s been my experience that people who smoke weed either grow it themselves or buy it from a friend who does. I’m fairly certain most drug cartels deal more in drugs that are more profitable and more difficult for the average person to get on their own than they do cannabis.

Wow, could you be any more retarded.

Seriously, do some research before you go typing paragraphs of shit.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Fuskox
item.description:
Yeah Patrick I don’t think you know what you’re talking about, my dad makes 300,000 a year, gives lots of it to my mom (divorced), and supports my 2 brothers and his girlfriend, and we seem to do just fine. Also we live in New York where taxes are retardedly high.

item.title: Found this plant not far from my place...
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
Patrick:

You must be living a different life style than me than. Because my dad makes about 230,000 grand a year, and we still barely get by. Then again, he has to support a family of 4 though.

Uhh, no. I doubt that. If he’s making 230,000 a year then he’s making a LOT of money and far more than he needs to support a family of 4. So either he’s blowing it all on drugs or he doesn’t really make 230,000 a year.

Read full topic
item.source: Found this plant not far from my place...

item.title: Found this plant not far from my place...
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
garrthbarrttinn:

Throwing this out there not directed at anyone in particular:
Just because alcohol and tobacco is legal doesn’t mean weed should be legal. That’s like saying Hitler’s already killed the Jews, he might as well kill the Gypsies too.

IMO alcohol shouldn’t be legal and tobacco DEFINITELY shouldn’t be legal, but it’s too late to stop it now, both are already too set in to get rid of with another disaster like prohibition. Lets stop weed before it becomes yet another blemish on our blackened society.

Stop forcing your will on other people through government. It’s not your decision to make.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
Chickenprotector:

It just pisses me off with the annoying dumbasses who don’t have the slightest clue what they’re talking about and call it WORSE than tobacco.

Honestly, I would say tobacco is a little better for you. But of course I’m not talking about modern day tobacco products. I’m talking about pure tobacco.

Legalizing weed wouldn’t be as good as everyone thinks, though. Why? Because companies would do the same with it as they have with tobacco. Nicotine filled cannabis cigarettes, anyone? And I don’t get how you can believe that legalizing it would take money away from drug cartels. It’s been my experience that people who smoke weed either grow it themselves or buy it from a friend who does. I’m fairly certain most drug cartels deal more in drugs that are more profitable and more difficult for the average person to get on their own than they do cannabis.

item.title: Found this plant not far from my place...
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Diabeetus:

Lazy and apathetic? I smoke daily and have kids, own a house and make 65,000 a year. For someone who has never tried it you seem to have pretty totalitarian opinions in the matter.

That’s why I said there are exceptions. There are exceptions to everything, you’re one of them.

Every day I see hundreds of kids at my highschool that smoke it and I see tens of kids who don’t smoke it. And even several that have just started. That’s a lot more accurate than “I smoked it and I turned out okay”.

Read full topic

item.title: Found this plant not far from my place...
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

Just because it’s been classed illegal it’s a BAD thing, as far as I’M aware, it’s because it’s so easy to produce/sell the government have no way of making money from it, so simple, they make it illegal and charge the people they catch selling it.

Actually, moderating the use and growth of it (like an alcohol/firearms license but for growing weed) would be best. You get caught, you get fined. Simple enough.

I’m not ‘pro’ weed at all, never tried it, never will. But I’ve always had the stance: “You want to do it go right ahead, just leave me out of it.”

It just pisses me off with the annoying dumbasses who don’t have the slightest clue what they’re talking about and call it WORSE than tobacco. They have no concrete proof and they just want to ‘protect’ the nations youth. In reality, a lot of man power and currency is wasted on trying to control it, while quite a lot of people make money off of it (if they don’t grow it themselves, they need to go to a distributor, sometimes that distributor could be a batch of very bad people).

The stupidest shit that I’ve seen is the 1920’s prohibition inside of the United States. This stuff still exists, it’s just with drugs. While some shit can really fuck you up cough meth cough. The legalization of the growth and sale of cannabis and some of the ‘safer’ drugs would likely harm the drug cartels that are trying to make the cash off of it more than the efforts from countries around the world trying to moderate and stop it at their boarders, and will likely cause an influx of some cash back into the rotting economies of some of the more developed countries. I see nothing wrong with people using it to unwind, but it needs to be moderated else the situation could get out of control.

Read full topic

item.title: Found this plant not far from my place...
item.dc:creator: Diabeetus
item.description:
garrthbarrttinn:

My humble opinion:
Weed makes people lazy and apathetic. It degrades society and should be avoided and destroyed. Of course, all in moderation may apply, but it’s easiest just to keep away from it than attempt to moderate your consumption. And yes these are generalizations, they aren’t true for a lot of people possibly including you, but for the majority they are.

I have never smoked weed myself, but I live in a town that takes stoner culture to an absurd extreme. I hate it.

My advice: leave that male plant there. And try to get a hold of more of them if you can and start planting them everywhere. Fuck over the local growers, they deserve it.

Lazy and apathetic? I smoke daily and have kids, own a house and make 65,000 a year. For someone who has never tried it you seem to have pretty totalitarian opinions in the matter.

Read full topic
item.source: Found this plant not far from my place...

item.title: Found this plant not far from my place...
item.dc:creator: Mango_Assassin
item.description:
Siggs:

Eh. Make me try again. I DARE YOU

Is that a challenge brother?

You can just tell that’s male straight off. (past experience off growing five plants, all with proper equipment.) (non-profit btw.)

To be honest the stuff is smoked by everyone from all ages here, less psychological and physical damage, as compared to the ever so right and completely legal fine alcohol, right?

as long as you don’t have copious amounts they will just confiscate it if they really want to, even then that’s pretty much the harshest punishment here, you can probably get away with it 4/5 times before they decide to fine you, then jail/fine if your taking the piss.

Just because it’s been classed illegal it’s a BAD thing, as far as I’M aware, it’s because it’s so easy to produce/sell the government have no way of making money from it, so simple, they make it illegal and charge the people they catch selling it.

Read full topic

item.title: Found this plant not far from my place...
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
I know people that have tried it and are fine, and a couple of people that were heavy users and have had frightening personality changes (this was very excessive use). But a heavy drinker will become a different person, so I guess it’s all swings and roundabouts. Personally I’ve never seen the attraction but I try not to judge.

However, if you can truly call yourself a mature adult (as many of you do when you’re calling a fellow poster a 12-year old) you would never, ever recommend or encourage a minor to try it. I enjoy my drinking sessions as much as the next man, but despite being asked several times I’ll never buy alcohol for a minor. What’s fine for an adult isn’t good for younger people, whatever they may think. Inevitably they’ll try their own stuff and make their own mistakes, which is part of growing up, but balanced advice is better than impressing your own views on them

Read full topic
